justification: The paper discusses the integration of executive functions into the Cattell-Horn-Carroll taxonomy, suggesting that working memory is considered within this framework, which includes tasks designed to measure specific cognitive abilities.

The paper mentions the Miyake three-factor model, which includes updating, shifting, and inhibition as core components of executive functions, indicating these specific types of tasks are used to measure executive functions.

The introduction draws a connection between self-regulation and executive functions, suggesting that tasks designed to measure the three factors of executive functions (updating, shifting, inhibition) are used to assess self-regulation.
